alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:49PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Okfuskee County through 1230 AM CDT... At 1149 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles east of Johnson to 2 miles south of Little to 3 miles southwest of Seminole. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Okemah... Boley... Paden... Bearden... Castle... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 221. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
